remarks: Define the class of all division rings (sometimes called skew fields). A division ring is a unital ring where every element except the additive identity has a multiplicative inverse.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2009.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
df-drngo $p |- DivRingOps = { <. g , h >. | ( <. g , h >. e. RingOps /\ ( h |` ( ( ran g \ { ( GId ` g ) } ) X. ( ran g \ { ( GId ` g ) } ) ) ) e. GrpOp ) } $.
$d g h $.
